top_categories.workout_context: Gravel Roubaix's pocono Mountain gravel roads - steep sustained forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel Roubaix's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
80ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Gravel Roubaix, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Roubaix. Train it until it feels boring.
8,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravel Roubaix, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
8,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on pocono Mountain gravel roads - steep sustained. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 8,000ft of climbing on pocono Mountain gravel roads - steep sustained does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Gravel Roubaix’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Gravel Roubaix. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Gravel Roubaix demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride pocono mountain gravel roads - steep sustained climbs, technical rocky descents, remote forest roads at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 100 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 100 miles of pocono mountain gravel roads - steep sustained climbs, technical rocky descents, remote forest roads in Palmerton, Pennsylvania.
